publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Of the consecration of the bishops in the Church of England : with their succession, iurisdiction, and other things incident to their calling: as also of the ordination of priests and deacons. Fiue bookes: wherein they are cleared from the slanders and odious imputations of Bellarmine, Sanders, Bristow, Harding, Allen, Stapleton, Parsons, Kellison, Eudemon, Becanus, and other romanists: and iustified to containe nothing contrary to the Scriptures, councels, Fathers, or approued examples of primitiue antiquitie. By Francis Mason, Batchelour of Diuinitie, and sometimes fellow of Merton Colledge in Oxeford
monogr.author: Mason, Francis

div.p: GEntle Readers, the most materiall mistakings which I haue obserued, are these; some wherof notwithstanding are amended in most Copies; for other which escaped me, I craue your courteous pardons.

list.head: ERRATA.
list.item: Page. 57. line. 12. Northumb. Read Part of Northumb.
Ibid. line 10. from the law. Read in the Law.
P. 213. l. 23 ni the Eucharistim properly Read in the Eucharist improperly.

list.head: In the Margent.
list.item: Pag. 38. lit. b. dist. 25. Read dist. 14.
Pag. 60. lit. c. lib 4. Read lib. 11.
